intro: Ecbolium subserratum, commonly known as the serrated ecbolium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves with serrated edges, which contribute to its common name. The plant produces small, pale pink to white flowers that are clustered in racemes, adding to its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in temperate regions. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
